intro: Elytranthe leucophloea, commonly known as the white phloem elytranthe, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, pale pink or white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in tropical botany and ecological research.
